result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • James G Korn was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol or any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall not enter establishments where the primary purpose is the sale/service of alcohol.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant James G. Korn in custody and by Attorney Gordon R. Leech.  Court will address defense motion to withdraw at the conclusion of this hearing.  Defendant admits to priors and is in agreement that this is a 9th offense.  Argument by counsel.  Statement by defendant.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  Court grants defense motion to withdraw.
Order Terminating Attorney Gordon Leech as Defendant's Attorney of Record
Defendant's Attorney of Record Gordon Leech's Motion to Withdraw & Terminate Representation

Prosecuting Attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Attorney Gordon R. Leech in person.  Defendant appearing via video today for sentencing hearing due to illness.  Atty. Leech requests an adjournment to allow defendant to be able to appear in person for his sentencing hearing.  No objection from the State.  Court grants defense request for an adjournment.  Court requests clarification from counsel on PSI report regarding prior offenses.  Counsel to review and provide clarification at next hearing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Prosecuting Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James G. Korn in court in custody and by Attorney Gordon R. Leech.  Resolution reached.  State is requesting a PSI report be ordered.  Defense requests to proceed to sentencing without a PSI report.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1.  Court finds defendant guilty on Ct. 1 and orders Ct. 2 dismissed and read in.  Presentence Investigation Report ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
